summary:
Lead Mechanical Engineer with 16 years of experience in the oil and gas industry and 8 years of maritime practice.
Extensive knowledge and expertise in FPSO conversions; main propulsion, power plant and auxiliaries.
Able to lead all project phases from FEED support, construction, commissioning to handover to client.
Successfully completed more than 10 FPSO conversions for major clients - Shell, ExxonMobil, Woodside and Petrobras.

education.degree_name: Masters Degree in Engineering - M.Sc., Mechanical Engineer

education.field_of_study: Ship's Propulsion Complex and Associated Auxiliaries

profile_positions.description:
- Main propulsion, power/steam/fresh water generation, inert gas, cargo and 
                  ballast, fuel and lube oil storage/purification/distribution and associated auxiliary systems.
               - In-depth review of P&ID/F&ID generated by contractor’s engineering (Saipem).
                  Red lines, corrections, technical and Class (BV) compliance. 
               - New marine equipment technical datasheets review and approval of suitability for 25
                  years FPSO field-life. 
               - Review and approval of heavy lifting design/concept and execution plan(s). 
               - Coordination of discipline engineers - E&I, Piping, Structural. 
               - Assessment and approval of nominated fabricators and site supervisors. 
               - Develop and maintain detailed work progress report as an input to planning engineer and 
                  company's management. Addressing “areas of concern” and submit a recovery plan. 
               - Manage vessel marine systems punch list scope
               - Liaise with Completions/Commissioning for the final systems handover. 
               - Heavy involvement in Risk Safety Assessments and all HSE activities.
profile_positions.title: Lead Mechanical Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Completed project:

- FPSO OSX2 for OSX – Brazil
- FPSO Falcon – for Exxon Mobil
- FSO Yoho – for Exxon Mobil
- FPSO Capixaba – for Petrobras,
- FPSO Mondo – for Exxon Mobil
- FPSO Espirito Santo – for Petrobras
- FPSO Okha – for Woodside, Australia
- TDS 2000 – Semi sub, DP2 drilling platform for Odebrecht, Brazil
- FPSOs Marica and Saquarema - fot Petrobras

- Working for the Client management team (Exxon Mobile, Petrobras, Petronas, Shell, Woodside), converting an existing VLCC into a FPSO / FSO unit.
- Directing technical output and support for mechanical engineering requirements, including control and scheduling of all mechanical activities.
- Conducting research and studies of mechanical equipment performance in FPSO units.
- Providing technical support to resolve operational/maintenance issues.
- Reviewing technical procedures of new designed equipment/systems to ensure compliance with design specifications, standard rules/regulations and safety codes.
- Carrying out evaluations, clarifications, and wide decisions for equipment modifications or new replacement within the budget.
- Ensuring engineering function is compatible with the existing systems and operates without causing any system conflict.
- Responsibilities in accordance to the work scope detailed in the Refurbishment and Conversion Specifications – Engine room and to some extend top site.
- P&ID development, equipment specification, plant layout, two weeks look ahead plans, pumps and line sizing
- Company liaisons, FAT approvals in compliance with Class, Flag State and statutory regulations.
- Creating comprehensive close outs, equipment condition and work progress reports on a weekly base.
- Dry dock associated refurbishment items, tail-shaft, propeller and rudder
- Working in narrow cooperation with SBM’s engineering offices:
• SBM – Atlantia, Houston
• GUSTO Engineering B.V, Holland
• SBM Monaco
profile_positions.title: Lead Mechanical Engineer / Marine Superintendent

profile_positions.description:
- Offshore hydraulic/electro hydraulic cranes, winches and windlasses.
- Design works made in close partnership with HYDRALIFT, Norway, manufacturing, and installation and after sales services.
- Liable for the overall planning, cost, organization and performance of awarded contracts.
- Analyzed feedback from executed projects and used as an input for new tender budget estimates.
- List of Clients includes SBM, Shell, Nippon Steel, Modec, Prosafe, and McDermott.
profile_positions.title: Technical Manager, Offshore Department

profile_positions.description:
- Installation and commissioning of systems for local and remote engines and process control: YAMATAKE HONEYWELL, NAKAKITA, VAF, FISHER ROSEMOUNT, BRISTOL BABCOCK, LESLIE etc.
- Service and adjustment of Automatic Combustion Control systems for main and auxiliary boilers, burning management and alarms monitoring.
- Maintenance and fine-tuning of wide range speed governors for diesel engines and steam turbines. Adjustment of parallel operation among electrical generators, static, power distribution, frequency allocation, alarms and trips.
- Support and maintenance of systems measuring / maintaining temperature, humidity, air parameters, velocity, solution concentration, liquid volumes and levels.
- Primary liaison rules with the Client during the execution of the project, including change order negotiations.
- Contributed to a number of FPSO conversion projects in Malaysia and Singapore:
• FPSO “Perintis” – MSE Shipyard, Malaysia
• FPSO “Kuito” – Sembawang Shipyard, Singapore
• FPSO VI “Espadarte” – Kepel Shipyard, Singapore
• FPSO “Brasil” – Kepel Shipyard, Singapore
profile_positions.title: Senior Service Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Managed all aspects of maintenance and repair under the requirements of the Unattended
Machinery Space Protocol.
- Carried out emergency, scheduled and capital overhauls of low-speed, two-stroke main
engines: MAN - B&W and SULSER.
- Fine-tuning and adjustment of Variable Injection Timing systems.
- Responsible for the smooth and non-failure performance of the ship’s electrical power plant:
WARTSILA DIESEL, DAIHATSU, CATERPILLAR. Auxiliary boilers feed water treatment and
control on daily basis.
- Repeatedly performed maintenance of the entire auxiliary equipment on board: air compressors, heavy/lube oil purifiers, cargo and ballast pumps/turbines, steering gears etc.
- Submitted monthly-based technical condition reports to the Head Office for evaluation and control.
profile_positions.title: Third and Second Engineer - on board Very Large Crude Oil Carriers
